title: Man Arrested After Allegedly Making Antisemitic Remarks During Australia Day March | 10 News
description: Sydney's March for Australia rally took a dark turn this afternoon with a man arrested for hate speech after ranting in favour of Nazis and against Australian Jews.  Thousands of people across the country took part in the events mainly motivated by opposition to mass immigration and Muslim immigrants in particular. title: More Than 1,000 Homes Evacuated Amid Otways Fire Threat In Victoria | 10 News
description: Victoria is bracing for extreme weather conditions with temperatures forecast to break records in towns across the state's north.  It's also heightened fears of bushfires with several regions declared to be at extreme risk.  More than a thousand properties in the Otway Ranges are under evacuation orders ahead of the predicted fire danger. title: Perth Scorchers Claim Incredible Sixth Big Bash Title | 10 News

title: Australia Day Chaos, Record-Breaking Heatwave Hits Three States, Australia's Piano Man | 10 News+
description: Thousands of people have hit the streets to either celebrate or protest this Australia Day, as it seems the country is becoming increasingly divided.  A historic heatwave has forced several Australia Day events to be cancelled, prompting extreme warnings as temperature records tumble across the country.   He’s known for playing his 350-kilogram baby grand piano in some of the most iconic places across Tasmania, but now he has a new goal — to travel 15,000km across Australia within 45 days with his son. title: Record-Breaking Heat Across Australia Leads To Dangerous Bushfires | 10 News
description: Records are tumbling and we are being warned the heatwave impacting Victoria, South Australia and parts of New South Wales will only worsen tomorrow, with some inland areas expected to near 50 degrees. Those extreme temperatures are expected to worsen conditions for already out-of-control bushfires.
